HDITA: The XDITA id attribute is expressed using the identically named HTML5 attribute id. See for more details.

MDITA: At the topic level, the id attribute can be declared following the Pandoc YAML metadata block syntax. If the author does not declare a value for id in a YAML metadata block, the required topic id attribute should (RFC-2119?) be generated with a slug version of the topic title, following a process similar to the URL creation for posts in web content management systems. At the section level, id can be expressed using a value for the attribute preceded by a number sign/hash/pound sign and enclosed in curly brackets following the Pandoc heading identifier syntax.. Any instances of id in MDITA topics at the phrase or span level should (RFC-2119?) use the HDITA syntax. See for more details.
